tool.name: QuantWiz-IQ
tool.command:
cp '$input_file' '$input_file.name' && cat '$new_param_file' > '$iq_params' #if $input_purity_file.input_purity_file_option == "history": && cp '$input_purity_file.purity_type' '$input_purity_file.purity_type.name' && echo "Purity_corrections_values=$input_purity_file.purity_type.name" >> '$iq_params' #else: && PROG_PATH=`which QuantWiz_IQ` && cp \${PROG_PATH%/*}/Purity_correction/$input_purity_file.purity_type . && echo "Purity_corrections_values=$input_purity_file.purity_type" >> '$iq_params' #end if
&& QuantWiz_IQ '$iq_params' && cp '${input_file.name.rsplit('.',1)[0]}_${area_method}_${min_tol}.tsv' '$quant' && cp '${input_file.name.rsplit('.',1)[0]}_${area_method}_${min_tol}_noquant.tsv' '$noquant'

configfiles.configfile: #slurp Spectra_Folder=. Input_file_extension=$file_ext Label_type=$input_label.label_type Plex=$input_label.num_plex min_reporters=$min_reporters Spectrum_area=$area_method Base_reporter=$input_label.base_reporter Normalization=$normalization Peak_intensity_threshold=$peak_intensity_threshold Tol_unit=$tol_unit Tol_min=$min_tol Tol_max=$max_tol #slurp

param.name: file_ext
param.label: Input file type: MGF or mzML

param.name: label_type
param.label: Isobaric reporter labeling type (MS2 level): iTRAQ or TMT

param.name: base_reporter
param.label: Denominator reporter tag for ratio calculation (mention only base reporter integer value)

param.name: base_reporter
param.label: Denominator reporter tag for ratio calculation (mention only base reporter integer value)

param.name: min_reporters
param.label: Minimum number of reporter types required to consider a spectrum for quantitation. Default is 2

param.name: peak_intensity_threshold
param.label: Reporter label maximum peak intensity threshold
param.help: Reporter label maximum peak intensity threshold to consider the tag for quantitation. Default is 0. It depends on signal to noise ratio (S/N)

param.name: input_purity_file_option
param.label: Use default or from the history

param.name: purity_type
param.label: Select purity correction file from the history

tool.help:
**QuantWiz-IQ** for Isobaric Quantitation
IQ stands for Isobaric Quantitator, a tool for quantitation based on of Isobaric tags (iTRAQ and TMT) that takes MGF as well as the HUPO-PSI standard mzML as input. It supports 4-plex and 8-plex quantitation for iTRAQ; and 2-plex, 6-plex and 10-plex quantitation for TMT.
**Parameters used**
**Input** : MGF or mzML spectrum file
**Isobaric label type** : iTRAQ or TMT
**Minimum reporters** : Specifies the minimum number of reporter types required in a spectrum, for it to be considered for quantitation. For example, in an iTRAQ-8plex experiment, it can take any value from 1 to 8. Default value is 2. If a spectrum does not have at least these many reporter types, quantitation is not performed on the spectrum.
**Spectrum area** : Specifies the type of area calculation method employed to perform quantitation. Options provided are "Sum intensity area method", "Trapezoid based area method", and "Sum intensity based Baseline corrected method".
**Base reporter** : Specifies the integer mass of reporter ion to be used as the denominator for calculating the ratios. In case of unidentified base reporter, the program would use first label of the reporter method as the base. For TMT, only a reporter ion from mass 126 to 131 is allowed while for iTRAQ only a mass from 113 to 121 is allowed excluding 120 (immonium phenylalanine ion also occurs at 120). Although integer reporter masses are used here, internally the program uses the vendor provided accurate masses of each reporter for quantitation to exploit high mass resolution.
**Normalization** : Normalization leads to reduction of all peak areas to a range of 0 to 1 for further analysis.
**Peak intensity threshold** : Sets the minimum absolute intensity required for a peak to be considered for quantitation. This parameter should be any positive integer.
**Tolerance unit** : Da or ppm
**Minimum tolerance** : Specifies the lower mass limit (m/z) of reporter ion to be allowed for quantitation (in Daltons).
**Maximum tolerance** : Specifies the upper mass limit (m/z) of reporter ion to be allowed for quantitation (in Daltons).
**Purity correction values** : Specifies the purity correction values for isotopic correction (generally provided by the respective vendors for peak area correction).
**Outputs** : Outputs parameters file along with two tabular files. One tabular file contains spectra that shows quantitation, and the other tabular file with spectra that didn't show any qualified quantitation.
